snippet: Nonfarm productivity increased at a 1.3 percent annual rate in the April-to-June period. But productivity, which measures hourly output per worker, rose only 0.3 percent from a year ago.
abstract: Labor Dept reports that worker productivity increased at annual rate of only 0.3 percent in second quarter, revising first-quarter productivity to decline of 1.1 percent; underlying data suggests that inflation could increase more quickly than expected.
lead_paragraph: Nonfarm productivity increased at a 1.3 percent annual rate in the April-to-June period. But productivity, which measures hourly output per worker, rose only 0.3 percent from a year ago.

headline.main: U.S. Productivity Increases, but Hints of Inflation Linger
headline.print_headline: Inflation Shows Hints of Accelerating as Productivity Rises
